content:
• Friday, April 21, 2017
  • EYEG

    EyeGate -4.8% after filing for offering

    • Clinical-stage firm EyeGate Pharmaceuticals (EYEG -0.5%) is 4.8% lower in postmarket trade after filing an S-1 to offer shares.
    • The company has registered initially for a maximum offering of $11.5M, with Wedbush PacGrow listed as underwriter.
    • It says it intends to use proceeds to support operations "including for clinical trials, for working capital and for other general corporate purposes."
    • Shares are up 28.2% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:14 PM | 6 Comments
  • XOMA

    XOMA -9.6% as Novo Nordisk cancels exclusive deal

    • XOMA (XOMA +3.5%) has slid in after-hours trade, -9.6%, after saying that Novo Nordisk (NVO -1.4%) has terminated its exclusive license deal with the company, due to "strategic and business reasons."
    • That termination is effective 90 days from yesterday.
    • XOMA lowered guidance on potential milestone payments (for the next 36 months) accordingly, to $40M from a previous $50M.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:07 PM | 6 Comments
  • DRWI

    DragonWave still failing Nasdaq compliance, facing delisting

    • DragonWave (DRWI -2%) has heard from Nasdaq that it hasn't regained compliance with the exchange's minimum shareholders' equity requirement.
    • The company had been given until April 17 to maintain $2.5M in shareholders' equity but failed.
    • As a result, DragonWave was set to be delisted on May and will request a hearing to avoid that fate. Nasdaq's panel is empowered to grant up to 180 calendar days from yesterday to regain that compliance.
    • Shares are off another 2% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM | 2 Comments

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: IJS +2.7%. IWM +2.6%. IWC +2.4%. XHB +2.2%. XLI +2.2%.
    • Top losers: OIL -10.0%. USO -7.3%. BNO -6.9%. GDXJ -5.9%. VXX -5.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM
  • SLB

    Schlumberger call: Redeploying Gulf assets, activating idle capacity

    • Schlumberger (NYSE:SLB) -- now down 2.5% after missing on revenues in earnings earlier today -- plans to redeploy assets from the Gulf of Mexico to more profitable use, execs said on the company's earnings call.
    • Demand for offshore services in the Gulf slid in the first quarter, says Operations President Patrick Schorn, with pricing falling too far to turn a profit.
    • Meanwhile, strength in North America is prompting the company to mobilize idled assets. "We've always said that as soon as we had a clear path to profitability, we would start activating our idled capacity," said CEO Paul Kibsgaard -- and so it will redeploy its entire idled hydraulic fracturing fleet by the end of the year, meaning new hiring.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 2 Comments
  • PPC

    Pilgrim's Pride +10% after Vertical upgrades

    • Pilgrim's Pride (PPC +10.1%) jumps 10% to reach its highest level of the year after Vertical Group boosts its rating to Buy from Neutral.
    • The firm thinks the outlook for pricing is favorable for the chicken seller this year and next.
    • While Pilgrim's Pride is already up 36% YTD, Vertical's price target of $30 gives shares another 13% to run.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • OCN

    Ocwen downgraded at S&P

    • Yesterday's new legal assault has S&P cutting the credit rating on Ocwen Financial (NYSE:OCN) to B- from B. Ratings could be cut further, says S&P, as the allegations could potentially threaten the company's viability.
    • Ocwen has given up most of the early morning bounce, now higher by 1.6%.
    • Altisource Portfolio Solutions (ASPS -3.7%), New Residential (NRZ +0.6%)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM | 68 Comments

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: STV +32%. IPDN +14%. DWCH +10%. INTT +8%. NPTN +7%.
    • Losers: HMNY -10%. MANH -10%. EFII -9%. MYSZ -8%. NCR -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • TOSYY

    Nikkei: KKR planning joint bid for Toshiba Memory

    • Down as much as 6.7% today in U.S. trading, Toshiba (TOSYY -3.5%) is cutting losses after a Nikkei report suggests that KKR (KKR -0.9%) will team with Japan's Innovation Network Corp. for a joint offer for Toshiba's memory-chip unit.
    • Such a tender would put the KKR group in pole position, Nikkei suggests. The group would participate in the second bidding round for the NAND unit, set to happen in May.
    • Western Digital (WDC -1.2%) is still considered among the leaders and may join in as well, along with the Development Bank of Japan. Despite bids from WDC rivals that are reportedly as high as ¥3T (about $27.5B), "the amount offered isn't everything," Nikkei quotes a senior Toshiba exec as saying. (via Reuters)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 3 Comments
  • IHRTQ

    IHeartMedia -3.1% with bondholders reportedly uniting to block exchange

    • IHeartMedia (IHRT) is off 3.1% with trading picking up alongside news that a group of its lenders have come together to block its debt overhaul, as Reuters reports.
    • That would start to choke off options for the struggling company aside from bankruptcy, as it works to address a debt pile amounting to $20B. The bondholders in question say they represent more than half of the term loan holders, enough to stop a debt swap.
    • The latest deadline for IHeartMedia's loan swap offer is later today; it's been postponed a couple of times.
    • Meanwhile, a filing from the company -- owner of iHeartRadio and Clear Channel Outdoor Holdings (CCO -3.4%) -- says that it expects to include a going-concern doubt in upcoming financials, due to continued negative cash flow and nearly $350M in debt coming due this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • RCKY

    Post-earnings rip for Rocky Brands

    • Rocky Brands (RCKY +11.5%) shoots higher after topping Q1 profit estimates. The company doubled revenue in its military segment to help give it some sales leverage. SG&A expenses fell to 570 bps to 27.6% of sales during the quarter.
    • The increase in lower-margin military sales did lead to a 160 bps drop in the company's gross margin rate to 31.3%.
    • Shares of Rocky Brands are back over $12 for the first time since early February.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • IPG

    Interpublic Group -2.1% as international results drag on revenues

    • Interpublic Group (NYSE:IPG) has slipped 2.1% in U.S. trading after Q1 revenues came up just short of expectations.
    • Revenue grew slightly overall in a seasonally small quarter, but was dragged by international results, where revenues fell 1.3% (up 2.2% on an organic basis).
    • But profits beat as net income available to stockholders nearly quadrupled, to $21.5M.
    • Revenue by geography: United States, $1.11B (up 1.9%); International, $642.1M (down 1.3%).
    • Cash and equivalents and marketable securities came to $778.1M as of March 31, vs. $1.1B at year-end 2016. Total debt was $1.92B.
    • The business is sound, says CEO Michael Roth. "We therefore believe we are well positioned to achieve our full year targets of organic revenue in the 3% to 4% range, as well as to improve operating margin by an additional 50 basis points relative to 2016 levels."
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:15 PM

    • Gainers: CARV +17%. OPHC +12%.CVCY +8%. LION +7%.
    • Losers: WAC -8%. PBIB -7%. ZAIS -6%. ENFC -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: STV +32%. GLBS +24%. CAI +22%. PTX +18%. CARV +18%. VOC +12%. OPHC +12%. RCKY +11%. AKTX +11%. DSX +11%.
    • Losers: XBIT -39%. ADMP -16%. CLW -15%. ONTX -14%. GNMX -14%. MNKD -13%. IMMU -13%. MAT -11%. HMNY -10%. ATRA -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM | 4 Comments
  • PFPT

    Proofpoint +8.1% after Q1 beat wows analysts

    • Proofpoint (NASDAQ:PFPT) is up 8.1% today, rebounding from Thursday losses following a beat-and-raise in its Q1 where it allayed worries about its sales force with solid growth in revenue and billings.
    • Bear arguments on the stock "go up in smoke," writes RBC's Matthew Hedberg, pointing to relief of sales worries as well as free cash flow margins of 25% that increased confidence in holding that margin to 2020. He's got a price target of $92, implying 19.8% upside from today's higher price.
    • The company's "executing flawlessly" and displacing old brand names Symantec, McAfee, Cisco and Microsoft, says Piper Jaffray's Andrew Nowinski, who has a $90 price target and still considers the stock a top pick for this year.
    • A higher price target of $97 comes from Morgan Stanley. The shift to Office 365 is a material catalyst, notes Melissa Gorham, and the company has a solid pipeline of deals going.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • COG

    Cabot Oil & Gas -2.2% after Raymond James downgrade

    • Analyst John Freeman is still bullish on the name, but he now rates it just Outperform instead of Strong Buy. He also cuts his estimate of net asset value $27 fro $32. Today's decline has the stock at just under $24.
    • Among his reasons is Cabot's (COG -2.2%) recent outperformance and the idea of less NAV upside given lower natural gas price assumptions.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: RCKY +12%. PPC +8%. NAKD +7%. STS +6%. SPU +6%.
    • Losers: CLW -14%. MAT -11%. FIZZ -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • ONTX

    Onconova prices stock offering at $2.10; shares down 14%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Onconova (ONTX -14.1%) slumps on almost a 4x surge in volume in response to the pricing of its public offering of 2,476,190 shares of common stock at $2.10. Net proceeds will fund the development of rigosertib for higher-risk MDS. Closing date is April 26.
    • Yesterday's close was $2.49.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • IMMU

    Immunomedics off 13% on no ASCO update on IMMU-132

    • Jefferies analyst Matthew Andrews says that Immunomedics (IMMU -12.9%) confirmed that it will not present an update on top cancer candidate IMMU-132 at ASCO in June.
    • A Phase 1/2 study in epithelial cancers is recruiting patients. Separate Phase 2 and Phase 3 studies in triple-negative breast cancer are about to start.
    • Source: The Fly
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 4 Comments

  • Oil tumbles below $50, dragging down energy names

    • A 2.3% drop today has crude oil below $50 per barrel for the first time in a month, now at $49.55. USO -1.85%
    • Alongside, the energy sector's (XLE -0.7%) loss is outpacing just a 0.1% decline in the S&P 500.
    • There's also earnings, and Schlumberger is off 3.15% after missing on revenues and offering a somewhat dour outlook. The SPDR Oil & Gas Services ETF (XES -2.2%).
    • ETFs: XLE, VDE, ERX, OIH, XOP, ERY, DIG, DUG, BGR, XES, IYE, IEO, FENY, IEZ, PXE, FIF, PXJ, RYE
     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM | 11 Comments
  • FUN

    Fun stuff for Cedar Fair as new all-time high struck

    • Stifel Nicolaus initiates coverage on Cedar Fair (FUN +1.7%) with a Buy rating and $78 price target.
    • The investment firm thinks the company will continue to increase EBITDA as it utilizes new land it acquired.
    • Shares of Cedar Fair crossed $70 for the first time ever today, topping out at $70.41 within the last hour. Even with the extended rally for FUN, the dividend yield is at 4.86% for new investors.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM | 14 Comments

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: PTX +18%. SSKN +9%. AKTX +8%. CASC +7%. AUPH +6%.
    • Losers: XBIT -39%. ADMP -16%. MNKD -14%. GNMX -14%. APRI -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 10 Comments
  • HA

    Hawaiian Holdings jets higher

    • Buckingham Research upgrades Hawaiian Holdings (HA +6.2%) to a Buy rating from Neutral.
    • The firm increases its price target to $63 from $55, saying the company found its "sweet spot" with strategy.
    • Shares of Hawaiian Holdings are up 6.26% on the day and are back over $55 for the first time in almost three months.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • SLB

    Schlumberger -3% after revenue miss, sluggish international outlook

    • Q1 adjusted income of $347M or $0.25 per share was inline with estimates, and down from $501M and $0.40 one year ago. Revenue of $6.89B was up 6% Y/Y, and shy of estimates by $100M.
    • Revenue fell 7% sequentially in international markets, and - speaking on the earnings call (IBD's Gillian Rich listening in) - management says 2017 looks like another challenging year. While Latin America has bottomed, Asia is showing no signs of recovery.
    • North America is looking better, with the company expecting a 50% increase in investment levels this year.
    • International accounts for about 75% of company revenue.
    • Previously: Schlumberger EPS in-line, misses on revenue (April 21)
    • SLB -3%
     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM | 2 Comments
  • I

    Reuters: Intelsat/OneWeb debt exchange to get several weeks more

    • Working to keep a merger with OneWeb alive and satisfy holdout bondholders, Intelsat (I -2.1%) is planning to extend a deadline on its debt exchange by several weeks, Reuters reports.
    • A deadline from last night will go out to at least mid-May, the report says.
    • SoftBank (SFTBY +0.2%) moved to merge OneWeb with Intelsat in February in a deal contingent on bondholder approval that would help cut $3.6B from Intelsat's $15B in debt.
    • But some of the debt is trading above the deal's exchange price, and SoftBank may be reluctant to sweeten that deal.
    • Holders of at least 85% of the face value of each series need to agree to the exchange to consummate the deal.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM | 12 Comments
  • MAT

    Analysts dish out the good, the bad and the ugly on Mattel

    • Analysts agree that Mattel (MAT -10.4%) turned in a painful post-holiday quarter, but differ on how investors should view the toy stock.
    • BMO Capital advises long-term investors to buy Mattel on the weakness with the new CEO steering the company in the right direction. On the recent quarter, analyst Gerrick Johnson has an explanation. "In the toy industry, the first quarter is often called the fifth quarter, because it is where problems from the fourth quarter are often cleaned up -- this is precisely what we see happening with Mattel's business," he writes.
    • Goldman Sachs and SunTrust both cite execution risk in dropping their price target on Mattel to $25 and maintaining a Neutral/Hold ratings.
    • Today's note from Stifel may give dividend investors something to consider. "While we think performance will improve beginning in 2Q with the theatrical release of 'Cars 3' driving growth, our confidence around sustaining the dividend continues to wane, which could serve as an overhang for the shares, at least near-term," warns analyst Drew Crum.
    • MKM Partners: "Given the missteps seen in four of the last five years, we are skeptical about the current turnaround."
    • Sources: Bloomberg and CNBC, TheStreet.
    • Previously: Mattel misses by $0.15, misses on revenue (April 20)
    • Previously: Inventory overhang whacks bottom line at Mattel (April 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM | 30 Comments
  • CAI

    CAI International skyrockets to 52-week high

    • A huge profit beat sends shares of CAI International (NYSE:CAI) flying in early trading.
    • The company reported an average container utilization rate in Q1 of 95.7%, up 140 bps Y/Y. The railcar utilization rate fell 80 bps to 92.7% during the quarter.
    • "We have been able to increase prices on the sale of used containers and expect that in the second quarter of this year we are likely to report a gain on sale, compared to the losses we have incurred in recent quarters," noted CEO Victor Garcia.
    • Previously: CAI International beats by $0.14, beats on revenue (April 20)
    • Shares of CAI are up 23.03% to $19.07 and carved out a 52-week high of $19.37 earlier.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • KSU

    More on Kansas City Southern's Q1

    • Kansas City Southern (KSU -1.7%) reports carload volume rose 6% to 540.9K in Q1.
    • Revenue by segment: Chemical & Petroleum: $126.5M (+8%); Industrial & Consumer Products: $140.1M (-1%); Agriculture & Minerals: $116.3M (+6%); Energy: $69M (+64%); Intermodal: $83.5M (-2%); Automotive: $51.3M (+25%), Other: $22.8M (-12%).
    • Revenue per carload/unit grew 4% to $1,085.
    • Operating margin rate improved 120 bps to 34.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM

  • Premarket Losers as of 9:05 am

    • XBIT -33% on announcing outcome of European Medicines Agency's oral explanation meeting.
    • ADMP -14% on announcing equity offering.
    • ONTX -12% on announcing public stock offering.
    • HMNY -11%.
    • TXMD -7%.
    • APRI -6% on pricing equity offering.
    • GNMX -5% ahead of presentation at the World Congress on results from the SAGA study.
    • MAT -5% on Q1 earnings.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM | 1 Comment
  • AUPH

    Aurinia's voclosporin meets all 48-week endpoints in mid-stage LN study; shares ahead 5% premarket

    • Aurinia Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AUPH) is up 5% premarket on robust volume in response to its announcement of positive 48-week data from the Phase 2b AURA-LV study assessing voclosporin for the treatment of lupus nephritis. The results are being presented at the National Kidney Foundation 2017 Spring Clinical Meetings in Orlando, FL.
    • The complete and partial remission endpoints were met in additional to all pre-specified secondary endpoints.
    • Previously: Aurinia's truncated late-stage development plan for voclosporin propels shares 6% premarket (April 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM | 37 Comments
  • OCN

    Ocwen upgraded at Compass Point; shares higher by 13% premarket

    • Fred Small at Compass Point has been a notable bear on Ocwen Financial (NYSE:OCN) in the past, so his upgrade to Buy this morning is at least somewhat notable. Shares are higher by 13% in active premarket action, but the move is barely a blip compared to yesterday's 53% washout.
    • Wedbush's Hencry Coffey says Nationstar Mortgage (NYSE:NSM) could be a beneficiary of the latest Ocwen issues, maybe taking over the servicing Ocwen currently handles for New Residential, or possibly picking up business from Walter Investment (WAC) or PHH.
    • Altisource Portfolio Solutions (NASDAQ:ASPS) +7.3%; Altisource Residential (NYSE:RESI) +2.4%
    • New Residential (NYSE:NRZ) +2.6%
    • Previously: Ocwen takes issue with state regulators (April 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM | 43 Comments

  • Premarket Gainers as of 9:05 am

    • STV +44% on declaring special cash dividend to shareholders.
    • INUV +28%.
    • OCN +16% on strongly disputing the key allegations raised by the State Regulators and will continue to work cooperatively to achieve an acceptable resolution.
    • ASPS +8%.
    • VBLT +7%.
    • AUPH +6% on announcing additional 48-week results from its global Phase IIb AURA-LV study in lupus nephritis.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • V

    Ohio AG probes Visa

    • The State of Ohio Office of the Attorney General issues a civil investigative demand against Visa (NYSE:V) relating to debit cards, debit card transaction routing procedures and cardholder verification methods.
    • The company says it's cooperating with the investigation.
    • The disclosure was made as part of Visa's 10-Q filing with the SEC.
    • Shares of Visa are up 2.24% premarket after yesterday's earnings beat.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM | 31 Comments
  • ATRA

    Atara Bio to collaborate with Merck on ATA129-Keytruda combo in NPC; shares up 11% premarket

    • Thinly traded micro cap Atara Biotherapeutics (NASDAQ:ATRA) is up 11% premarket, albeit on only 559 shares, in response to its announcement of a clinical trial collaboration with Merck evaluating the combination of its allogeneic Epstein-Barr virus (EBV)-specific cytotoxic T lymphocytes (ATA129) and Keytruda (pembrolizumab) in patients with platinum-resistant or recurrent EBV-associated nasopharyngeal carcinoma (NPC).
    • An Atara-sponsored Phase 1/2 study should be initiated next year. Financial terms are not disclosed.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • BPY

    Brookfield Property boosts terms for Brookfield Canada Office Properties

    • The two have agreed on C$32.50 per share for the 17% interest that Brookfield Property Partners (NYSE:BPY) currently doesn't own. That's $2.40 per share more than BPY's original proposal in January, and 2.8% higher than BOX's close in Toronto last night.
    • BOX trades on the NYSE as well under BOXC.
    • Previously: Brookfield Canada +19%; analysts see better offer coming (Jan. 23)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM | 4 Comments
  • XBIT

    XBiotech gets thumbs down on CRC candidate in pre-opinion meeting with EMA advisory committee; shares plummet 33% premarket

    • Thinly traded micro cap XBiotech (NASDAQ:XBIT) is down 33% premarket on increased volume in response to its announcement of a negative outcome from its meeting with members of the European Medicines Agency's advisory committee regarding its Marketing Authorization Application (MAA) seeking approval of its candidate antibody to treat colorectal cancer.
    • In a meeting to discuss the Day 180 List of Outstanding Issues, members of the advisory committee CHMP rendered a "negative trend" vote which means that a positive opinion from its formal review of the MAA is unlikely. The key stumbling block appeared to be clinical relevance.
    • CEO John Simard says, “We are disappointed by the outcome of the meeting. We believe that the data speak in a clear and resounding voice to clinical relevance of a new antibody therapy in advanced colorectal cancer. We believe that findings from our Phase III study show that we have developed an important endpoint and methodology to evaluate anti-cancer therapy in advanced stage disease and that our monoclonal antibody represents a breakthrough treatment in patients with advanced colorectal cancer. The EMA marketing authorization application procedure enables the appeal of negative decisions from the oral explanation. We may seek access to this process at the appropriate time.”
     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM | 1 Comment
  • HAS

    Hasbro stung by soft Mattel results

    • Shares of Hasbro (NASDAQ:HAS) trade lower after Mattel cited a "retail inventory overhang" as it sputtered out of the holiday period.
    • Previously: Mattel misses by $0.15, misses on revenue (April 20)
    • Previously: Inventory overhang whacks bottom line at Mattel (April 20)
    • HAS -2.10% premarket to $93.99 vs. a 52-week trading range of $76.14 to $101.18.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM | 3 Comments
  • GNMX

    Aevi Genomic to present data today from failed SAGA study; shares ease 9% premarket

    • Aevi Genomic Medicine (NASDAQ:GNMX) is down 9% premarket on light volume ahead of a presentation today at the World Congress on ADHD on results from the SAGA study assessing lead product candidate AEVI-001. Shares plummeted last month after the company announced it failed to beat placebo in adolescents with mGluR mutation-positive ADHD.
    • Previously: Aevi Genomic's lead product candidate flunks ADHD study; shares plummet 56% (March 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM | 1 Comment
  • GNTX

    More on Gentex's Q1

    • Gentex (NASDAQ:GNTX) reports Automotive net sales increased 13% to $445.6M in Q1, due to 12% rise in auto-dimming mirror unit shipments .
    • Total auto-dimming mirror units +1092 Y/Y to 9,919.
    • Gross margin rate fell 30 bps to 38.8% due to annual customer price reductions.
    • Operating margin rate down 20 bps to 29.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 AM
  • KSU

    Kansas City Southern beats by $0.01, beats on revenue

    • Kansas City Southern (NYSE:KSU): Q1 EPS of $1.17 beats by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $609.5M (+8.3% Y/Y) beats by $10.19M.
    • Shares +1.58% PM.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 8:03 AM | 9 Comments
  • FTNT

    BMO spots value in Fortinet; shares up 1% premarket

    • An attractive valuation amid coming market share gains make for a good combination, and BMO analyst Keith Bachman upgrades to Outperform from Market Perform. His new price target of $46 is based on an enterprise value/free cash flow multiple of 16x-17x vs. an average of 18.6x over the past three years.
    • FTNT +1% premarket to $38.89.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:58 AM
  • BHC

    Valeant prices psoriasis med SILIQ at $3,500/month

    • Employing its pricing-by-committee approach to setting drug prices, Valeant Pharmaceutics (VRX) announces that the list price for injectable plaque psoriasis medication SILIQ (brodalumab) will be $3,500 per month. The company says it is the lowest price on the market for an injectable biologic to treat the skin condition. U.S. commercial launch will commence in H2.
    • Valeant established its Patient Access and Pricing Committee a year ago amidst criticism over its aggressive price hikes.
    • Shares are down 1% premarket after several sell-side shops cut price targets.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:50 AM | 234 Comments
  • GPT

    Gramercy Property Trust -2.5% after capital raise, earnings miss

    • The company sold 9M shares at $27.60 each for estimated net proceeds of $238.1M. The underwriters have an option to buy another 1.35M shares at that price.
    • In preliminary numbers released last night, Gramercy (NYSE:GPT) expects core FFO of $0.50-$0.51 per share in Q1 vs. estimates for $0.53.
    • Shares -2.45% premarket to $27.80.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 AM | 2 Comments
  • MCD

    BMO Capital sees McDonald's rally extending

    • BMO Capital initiates coverage on McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) with a Buy rating.
    • The investment firm begins coverage on the restaurant operator with a price target of $153. The consensus price target on McDonald's from Wall Street firms is $130.30.
    • Shares of McDonald's are up 0.53% premarket to $133.98 vs. a 52-week trading range of $110.33 to $133.44 (set yesterday)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:35 AM | 5 Comments
  • HON

    Honeywell +2.1% raising guidance range

    • Q1 adjusted EPS of $1.66 up 11% Y/Y, and topping estimates by $0.04.
    • Organic sales growth by segment in Q1: Aerospace flat; Home and Building +3%; Performance Materials +5%; Safety and Productivity +3%.
    • "Honeywell reported a strong start to 2017, with over 2% organic sales growth, 70 bps of segment margin expansion, and free cash flow of nearly $800M that was more than six times greater than 2016," CEO Darius Adamczyk declared. "As a result of our performance, we are raising the low end of our full-year guidance by $0.05. We now anticipate that 2017 earnings per share will be $6.90 to $7.10, up 7%-10%, excluding divestitures, any pension mark-to-market adjustments, and 2016 debt refinancing charges.
    • Conference call at 9:30 a.m. ET.
    • HON +2.1% premarket
    • Q1 results
     
     
     
     
    | 7:33 AM | 9 Comments
  • SHOO

    More on Steve Madden's Q1

    • Steve Madden (NASDAQ:SHOO) reports same-store retail sales fell 6% in Q1.
    • Wholesale net sales increased 13.6% to $313.3M
    • Retail gross margin up 250 bps to 58.7% due to a lower level of promotional activity.
    • Gross margin in the wholesale business grew 160 bps to 32.8% driven by an increase in the wholesale footwear segment.
    • Adjusted gross margin rate improved 130 bps to 36.6%.
    • Operating expenses as a percentage of sales down 10 bps to 26.8%.
    • Adjusted operating margin rate expanded 170 bps to 10.8%.
    • FY2017 Guidance: Net sales: +8% to +10%; GAAP EPS: $1.97 to $2.03; Adjusted EPS: $2.12 to $2.18.
    • SHOO -0.54% premarket.

    Apricus prices equity offering at $1.40/unit; shares off 2% premarket

    • Thinly traded nano cap Apricus Biosciences (APRI) slips 2% premarket on average volume in response to the pricing of its public offering of 5.03M units at $1.40 per unit.
    • Each unit consists of one share of common stock and one five-year warrant to purchase 0.75 of a share of common at $1.55. The warrants become exercisable only after the company receives shareholder approval to increase the number of authorized shares to 30M.
    • Net proceeds will fund the re-submission of the Vitaros NDA, working capital and general corporate purposes.
